item.title: Recursion
item.description: Definition Recursion is a technique for solving problems wherein a function makes calls to itself. By doing so, it can complete a small amount of the processing, and delegate the rest of the problem to the recursive calls. Recursive function always come with a function inside. With 2 minimum cases inside: a base case, and a recursive case. The base case is the situation or condition where we don’t need to recursively invoke the function and is safe to assume that that function can end easily.
